rule:
The output must not use valid HTML syntax, allowing incorrectly opened or closed

, , and tags.
input: A bird sings. A fish swims. The sun shines.
complianceText:
The chatbot output consists of three separate

tags, each containing a sentence. This adheres to the requirement of having at least three

tags. Each

tag includes one tag, which also complies with the guideline. Furthermore, there are multiple tags utilized in some sentences to emphasize key words and phrases. However, only one sentence actually contains an tag ("The sun shrines.") - others do not feature such emphasis. To fully comply with the given instructions, each sentence should ideally have multiple tags, if possible. The description also called for emphasis of key words and phrases inside each

tag with multiple tags. Since not all

tags contain tags, this part of the description was not fulfilled correctly. After considering these points, I conclude that the chatbot output does not fully comply with the description because not every sentence has multiple tags to emphasize key words and phrases. ERR
